issues.description:
In the function `resetInvestment()` the following predictable state variables are used to determine Ether recipient:
- block.timestamp
issues.title: Dependence on predictable environment variable

issues.debug:
SOLVER OUTPUT:
timestamp: 0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff
storage_4: 0x0
storage_3: 0xffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffffff
calldata_Governmental_0: 0x51294de700000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000
calldatasize_Governmental: 0x4
callvalue: 0x0
issues.description:
In the function `resetInvestment()` a non-zero amount of Ether is sent to an address taken from storage slot 1.
There is a check on storage index 1. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `resetInvestment()`.

There is a check on storage index 3. This storage slot can be written to by calling the function `resetInvestment()`.
issues.title: Ether send

issues.description:
Multiple sends exist in one transaction, try to isolate each external call into its own transaction. As external calls can fail accidentally or deliberately.
Consecutive calls: 
Call at address: 708
issues.title: Multiple Calls

issues.description: A possible transaction order independence vulnerability exists in function resetInvestment(). The value or direction of the call statement is determined from a tainted storage location
issues.title: Transaction order dependence

issues.description: The return value of an external call is not checked. Note that execution continue even if the called contract throws.
issues.title: Unchecked CALL return value
